entries.title: Player Interview: Darren
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"I played my first D&D game at highschool. It was a boring game where there were so many players and so little time that I could barely get to do anything, but it was still alright."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"I've mostly only done D&D 5e, before we got into savage worlds. At highschool and mostly on Roll20."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Most of the fun that I get comes when I overcome some huge challenge, like with Lykel. When he was wrestling and battling the Fomorian, and battling with the dwarven soldiers."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"A game where I don't get to do anything. Or where everything I do results in failure."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"In real life I mostly enjoyed making jokes about how I seduced a goblin as we were both falling to our deaths.Or interrogated a rock which I believed to be a gnome, while proclaiming myself as batman."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"I've played Lykel and Cecil."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"I play Darkest Dungeon, Blazblue, Fire Emblem, and a little bit of Skyrim. Mainly Fire Emblem."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"I suppose that I most enjoy acting upon some heroic quality. But I don't have many ideas aside from that. Aside from maybe risk-taking. Creating conflict amongst the party."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book of all times?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"Hm. I suppose that the first few Eragon books were great."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: StrangeSpeeder
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"],["em"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"About a year or two ago. Maybe three-ish i haven't kept count."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"I've played quite a bit, but only with two groups."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Generally I find tackling massive battles to be pretty fun, even more so if both sides are obviously a cut above the rest. Other than that, having fun RPing."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"The most unfun thing that HAS happened imo, are 'cutscenes'. As an example, when encountering a new type of foe, we were 'supposed' to lose, and be rescued."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"Nothing in particular comes to mind, as I can remember "],[0,[1,1],2,"most"],[0,[],0," of what i cared about of any given campaing. I guess the time my party got betrayed in a dessert and had to fight off an aspect of tiamat and our rival party at the same time is one. Finding that same rival party dead in a dungeon, minus 1, and then going through said dungeon and finding it was everything i could do to keep my comrades alive, was another."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Arya, Alice, and the last one who's name escapes me, a weird scientist."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"Recently, Slay the Spire, SCP Containment Breach, and Warframe are my primary games of choice."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"One part power fantasy, one part casual roleplaying."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book of all times?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"Artemis fowl's series was cool. So was another series by the same author who's name escapes me."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Ratt
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"When I was 9 my babysitter walked us through a modern adventure, there werent stats dice or maps but it was still a ttrpg"]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"Good ones, I like them buy and large"]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"The exploration of a consistent universe. Things follow rules, and no two opposite things can happen at once (like a piece of wood simultaneously being on fire and impossible to set on fire), and roleplaying with a team that gets along"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"A session where there was clearly something that the DM wanted to accomplish and they threw out rules, of both the game and of the in universe logic, to achieve it, in order to do something to the players, or where they let the players do anything throwing out the rules"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"From a private session with my family, when I was 10 I was the DM for totally free form diceless games my cousins would play at Thanksgiving, and it became a running gag that whenever I was bored I would either kill someone via bus or make someone find a cat that also was a god, the moment I still remember years later is when only one character was left, they walked out of their apartment building with a new robot arm, they we're getting evicted, feeling sad, when I hit them with a bus, instant death. I was hungry, and the adults were serving some kind of dessert. From an Ashenland game, the most recent campaign has been by far the best, and Alexis and Pines response to Als death was by far the best"]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Kosh the fire cultist, Dober the Doglin Warlord and Pines the goblin sniper."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"Lots, video games, board games and rpgs. I'm particularly fond of TF2, Portal, Munchkin and Legend"]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"Character creation from both the DMs and the Players side. There is world building character building and rules all in one"]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"Worm, I was emotionally invested through 7000 pages, that takes a lot"]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Merpac
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"],["em"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"My first time playing was actually last summer, sometime in August."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"I have some experience. I've played about 12-20 hours, but most of it was casual. I'm mostly set on the standard rules but strategy wise not so much."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Designing a character and roleplaying as them!"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"Dm bans all roleplaying. That would suck."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"It was our first battle, and we had to kill some rats. There was about 5, and we got through the first 4 easily, but for the last one we kept rolling, low so it took us about 15 minutes to kill one rat."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"This is my first time playing in the Ashenland world and I'm playing as Quinn Brightlace, a sweet, mild halfling wizard."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"I play some dating-sim app games every once in a while. I wish I could play more games, but i can't afford them. I just stick to watching gamers on Youtube."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"The \"RP\" part. I also like how much variety you can have in your characters."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"I have to many to choose from... Right now I'd say "],[0,[1,1],2,"Romeo and/or Juliet"],[0,[],0," by Ryan North is my favorite. He's such a comedic author, and the book is a fresh take on the classic story."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Laura
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[1,"p",[]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"When I entered this server, so in November-December of 2017."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"About 1-2 years of book reading and campainging."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"The roleplay in itself and the social interactions within the party"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"Lose a character for any reason, except if it's explained and consented"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"Daeris' love triangle"]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Daeris, Kilmie, Aimu, Doctor Carlisle and Evelin. Currently Alma."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"Simulations such as The Sims 4 and Rimworld, MOBA's such as League of Legends, Visual Novels such as Doki Doki Literature Club and Those Without Names and any other games that catch my eye. I'm pretty eclectic, though I don't really enjoy fighting games."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"Uhm, the randomness that comes with the dice and the nerdiness of the players hehe."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"A Chave do Tamanho (The Key of Size) by Monteiro Lobato, as far as I'm aware there's no English translation though."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Wesley
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[1,"p",[]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"Around my junior year in high school"]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"On and off for about 15 years with 2 games that lasted more than a year each, the longest being about 3 years. As well as a DM in a couple of games, the longest lasting about 6 months."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"I get the most fun from telling a story through RP"]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"Being obviously railroaded into or out of a situation."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"I had a Kitsune Wild Sorcerer in a 3.5 game that was going for about 8 months at the time who was in love with an NPC that acted as a teacher and a father figure to her. In this one session however that NPC had been found out to be working against the party toward some opposing goal. Being torn between her love for the NPC and her loyalty to the party the session turned into a very well performed drama between the party trying to convince her to leave the NPC and help them against him. Just as they thought they had her convinced she had managed to lure them into a trap for her love. The party had to fight both the NPC and her and they managed to defeat the NPC but he ran off and they subdued her. By the end of the session they had her convinced the NPC had her under some kind of spell that made her love him and she agreed with them, but knew that was not the truth because she had loved him for years before she had met the rest of the party."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Lael"]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"D&D(or other TTRPG), Warhammer 40k, Skyrim, Sims 4, Rimworld, and then just about any multiplayer game that a majority of my friends are playing at the time or any single player game that comes out that I feel like playing but those are the games I keep going back to all the time. My Steam library alone has around 300 games in it."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"The one thing I like above all other things about TTRPGs is that there is no set way to handle anything. So you can do anything in an attempt to do what you are trying to do without it having to be preprogramed. Want to kill everything, go for it. Want to never have a single combat and solve everything by talking your way out of it or using politics to take care of everything , go for it."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"That is a hard question. I have 'read' more books in the last 2 years than I have in the rest of my life. If you asked me this question about 3 years ago I likely would say The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, but now? I have to give a top 5 in no order as I cant pick just one between these, Red Shirts by John Scalzi, the NPCs series by Drew Hayes, Off to Be the Wizard series by Scott Meyer, Hell Divers series by Nicholas Sansbury Smith, and Critical Failures series by Robert Bevan. I know this is not really a good answer to the question but I have been reading just so many good stories that are all still fresh enough in my mind that none of them stand out above the rest for me."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Nope
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"(translated by Laura from weeb to english)"]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"Probably some time last year, I can't quite remember. Joined a D&D session, in Tabletop Simulator, and played a 5e one-shot as a warlock. After that I played another 3 short sessions, when that ended I looked to play more D&D sessions, which was when I started using roll20 and played the first campaign in this group. Technically that was the first actual campaign I played."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"Aside from what is above, I haven't played much other than D&D. The earliest I remember would be only watching a few shows, not entirely though, and having some friends that play, includind Speeder."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"The two main things would be that I like being part of the huge power battles, fighting bosses or entire armies, being part of a battle between PCs aand whatever enemy feels really good. Secondly, I enjoy long battles that end up as a battle of resistance, going on until the last man is down or until one of the sides tires, that is also great."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"Being unable to act in an encounter, either because my character is outclassed or because the enemy has us tied."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"If not actual plot, that one fight where Eahthryd was shooting arrows and casting spells at the dwarves, that was cool. If actual plot, I really enjoyed the whole conflict at Alisont, with Kosh Zig being an antagonist. Although, in that campaign, many NPCs had the power to render the spellcasters useless in seconds, which falls under 4. Memorable anyway."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Yu'karin, Nithnirith, Eahthryd, X'arith, Rose and Augusta."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"That I remember I play the more recent xcom games, Albion online, H3VR, Kerbal Space Program, Dota 2, Divinity: Original Sin 2, Planetside 2, Borderlands 2 and Tower Unite. "]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"The idea that those fights mentioned on 3 can happen, although i do prefer to work up to it and then be presented to that type of situation, that appeals to me the most."]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"I haven't read any books lately."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Petya
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"When I joined this group. So March 2019."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"About two months."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Seeing characters interact and develop. Also fighting monsters is kinda cool."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"When the flow of the game gets slowed down for whatever reason, because I get fidgety and tend to loose concentration (but that's my own fault)."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"The first encounter with the big crocodile. 3/4 of the party was unconscious in the first 10 seconds and I was pretty sure we were all going to die."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"Nelith the tiefling bard."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"Mostly board or card games."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"That you can be literally anything you want. Getting to explore part of your own personality in ways you normally couldn't. "]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,8],[0,[],0,"The Count of Monte Cristo by Alexandre Dumas."]]]]]}

entries.title: Player Interview: Alejandro
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"]],"sections":[[3,"ol",[[[0,[0],1,"When was the first time you played pen-and-paper RPG?"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"The first time was definitely in roll 20. I played there in 3 different games(although one of them doesn't really count)."]],[[0,[0],1,"What is your experience in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"This one was my first time. The other was canceled so my first was in 2019. So my experience is almost all coming from underworld of ashen land."]],[[0,[0],1,"What brings you the most fun in tabletop RPGs?"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"I had fun trying to figure out who my character was and what was his story. Constantly tweaking it to be better and getting rid of the unesesary pieces and bad parts."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most un-fun thing that may happen on a session, in your opinion?"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"The most unfun thing would be that I tried to play in the session but my computer decided to not charge until it died and I had to leave midsession."]],[[0,[0],1,"What's the most memorable story you remember from a session?"],[1,[],0,4],[0,[],0,"The most memorable story has to be when a friend charged the water spirits and sacrificed himself to save us by killing all of them."]],[[0,[0],1,"What characters have you played as in Ashenland campaigns?"],[1,[],0,5],[0,[],0,"I just played 1 Flutter."]],[[0,[0],1,"What games do you play in general? Any games."],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"I'm not picky about the games I play but I do like ashenlad the best out of the limited 3 games I played on r20."]],[[0,[0],1,"What facet of tabletop RPGs appeals to you the most?"]],[[0,[0],1,"Best book ever?"],[1,[],0,7],[0,[],0,"Best book ever is a tough one as well as the facet of tabletop that appeals most to me"]]]]]}

entries.title: Creating a custom theme
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[["image",{"src":"https://static.ghost.org/v1.0.0/images/marketplace.jpg","caption":"Anyone can write a completely custom Ghost theme with some solid knowledge of HTML and CSS"}]],"markups":[["a",["href","https://ghost.org/marketplace/"]],["code"],["a",["href","https://github.com/TryGhost/Casper"]],["a",["href","https://ghost.org/docs/api/handlebars-themes/"]],["strong"],["a",["href","https://forum.ghost.org/c/themes"]]],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ghost comes with a beautiful default theme called Casper, which is designed to be a clean, readable publication layout and can be adapted for most purposes. However, Ghost can also be completely themed to suit your needs. Rather than just giving you a few basic settings which act as a poor proxy for code, we just let you write code."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"There are a huge range of both free and premium pre-built themes which you can get from the "],[0,[0],1,"Ghost Theme Marketplace"],[0,[],0,", or you can create your own from scratch."]]],[10,0],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ghost themes are written with a templating language called handlebars, which has a set of dynamic helpers to insert your data into template files. For example: "],[0,[1],1,"{{author.name}}"],[0,[],0," outputs the name of the current author."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The best way to learn how to write your own Ghost theme is to have a look at "],[0,[2],1,"the source code for Casper"],[0,[],0,", which is heavily commented and should give you a sense of how everything fits together."]]],[3,"ul",[[[0,[1],1,"default.hbs"],[0,[],0," is the main template file, all contexts will load inside this file unless specifically told to use a different template."]],[[0,[1],1,"post.hbs"],[0,[],0," is the file used in the context of viewing a post."]],[[0,[1],1,"index.hbs"],[0,[],0," is the file used in the context of viewing the home page."]],[[0,[],0,"and so on"]]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"We've got "],[0,[3],1,"full and extensive theme documentation"],[0,[],0," which outlines every template file, context and helper that you can use."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If you want to chat with other people making Ghost themes to get any advice or help, there's also a "],[0,[4],1,"themes"],[0,[],0," section on our "],[0,[5],1,"public Ghost forum"],[0,[],0,"."]]]]}
entries.custom_excerpt: Ghost comes with a beautiful default theme called Casper, which is designed to be a clean, readable publication layout and can be easily adapted for most purposes.

entries.title: Apps & integrations
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[["markdown",{"markdown":"<script src=\"https://zapier.com/apps/embed/widget.js?services=Ghost&container=true&limit=8\"></script>\n"}]],"markups":[["a",["href","https://zapier.com"]],["strong"],["a",["href","https://ghost.org/docs/api/handlebars-themes/"]],["em"],["a",["href","https://ghost.org/integrations/disqus/"]],["a",["href","https://ghost.org/integrations/discourse/"]],["a",["href","https://ghost.org/integrations/"]],["a",["href","https://prismjs.com/"]],["a",["href","https://www.google.com/forms/"]],["a",["href","https://www.typeform.com/"]],["a",["href","https://ghost.org/docs/api/"]],["a",["href","/themes/"]]],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"There are three primary ways to work with third-party services in Ghost: using Zapier, editing your theme, or using the Ghost API."]]],[1,"h1",[[0,[],0,"Zapier"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"You can connect your Ghost site to over 1,000 external services using the official integration with "],[0,[0],1,"Zapier"],[0,[],0,"."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Zapier sets up automations with Triggers and Actions, which allows you to create and customise a wide range of connected applications."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[1],1,"Example"],[0,[],0,": When someone new subscribes to a newsletter on a Ghost site (Trigger) then the contact information is automatically pushed into MailChimp (Action)."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[1],1,"Here are the most popular Ghost<>Zapier automation templates:"],[0,[],0," "]]],[10,0],[1,"h1",[[0,[],0,"Editing your theme"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"One of the biggest advantages of using Ghost over centralised platforms is that you have total control over the front end of your site. Either customise your existing theme, or create a new theme from scratch with our "],[0,[2],1,"Theme SDK"],[0,[],0,". "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"You can integrate "],[0,[3],1,"any"],[0,[],0," front end code into a Ghost theme without restriction, and it will work just fine. No restrictions!"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[1],1,"Here are some common examples"],[0,[],0,":"]]],[3,"ul",[[[0,[],0,"Include comments on a Ghost blog with "],[0,[4],1,"Disqus"],[0,[],0," or "],[0,[5],1,"Discourse"]],[[0,[],0,"Implement "],[0,[6],1,"MathJAX"],[0,[],0," with a little bit of JavaScript"]],[[0,[],0,"Add syntax highlighting to your code snippets using "],[0,[7],1,"Prism.js"]],[[0,[],0,"Integrate any dynamic forms from "],[0,[8],1,"Google"],[0,[],0," or "],[0,[9],1,"Typeform"],[0,[],0," to capture data"]],[[0,[],0,"Just about anything which uses JavaScript, APIs and Markup."]]]],[1,"h1",[[0,[],0,"Using the Public API"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ghost itself is driven by a set of core APIs, and so you can access the Public Ghost JSON API from external webpages or applications in order to pull data and display it in other places."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[],0,"The Ghost API is "],[0,[10],1,"thoroughly documented"],[0,[],0," and straightforward to work with for developers of almost any level. "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Alright, the last post in our welcome-series! If you're curious about creating your own Ghost theme from scratch, here are "],[0,[11],1,"some more details"],[0,[],0," on how that works."]]]]}
entries.custom_excerpt: There are three primary ways to work with third-party services in Ghost: using Zapier, editing your theme, or using the Ghost API.

entries.title: Organising your content
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"],["code"],["em"],["a",["href","https://ghost.org/docs/api/handlebars-themes/"]],["a",["href","http://yaml.org/spec/1.2/spec.html","rel","noreferrer nofollow noopener"]],["a",["href","https://ghost.org/docs/api/handlebars-themes/routing/"]],["a",["href","/apps-integrations/"]]],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ghost has a flexible organisational taxonomy called"],[0,[0],1," tags"],[0,[],0," which can be used to configure your site structure using "],[0,[0],1,"dynamic routing"],[0,[],0,". "]]],[1,"h1",[[0,[],0,"Basic Tagging"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"You can think of tags like Gmail labels. By tagging posts with one or more keyword, you can organise articles into buckets of related content."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"When you create content for your publication you can assign tags to help differentiate between categories of content. "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"For example you may tag some content with  News and other content with Podcast, which would create two distinct categories of content listed on "],[0,[1],1,"/tag/news/"],[0,[],0," and "],[0,[1],1,"/tag/weather/"],[0,[],0,", respectively."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If you tag a post with both "],[0,[1],1,"News"],[0,[],0," "],[0,[2],1,"and"],[0,[],0," "],[0,[1],1,"Weather"],[0,[],0," - then it appears in both sections. Tag archives are like dedicated home-pages for each category of content that you have. They have their own pages, their own RSS feeds, and can support their own cover images and meta data."]]],[1,"h1",[[0,[],0,"The primary tag"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Inside the Ghost editor, you can drag and drop tags into a specific order. The first tag in the list is always given the most importance, and some themes will only display the primary tag (the first tag in the list) by default. "]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[2,0],1,"News"],[0,[],1,", Technology, Startup"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"So you can add the most important tag which you want to show up in your theme, but also add related tags which are less important."]]],[1,"h1",[[0,[],0,"Private tags"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Sometimes you may want to assign a post a specific tag, but you don't necessarily want that tag appearing in the theme or creating an archive page. In Ghost, hashtags are private and can be used for special styling."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"For example, if you sometimes publish posts with video content - you might want your theme to adapt and get rid of the sidebar for these posts, to give more space for an embedded video to fill the screen. In this case, you could use private tags to tell your theme what to do."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[2,0],1,"News"],[0,[],1,", #video"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Here, the theme would assign the post publicly displayed tags of News - but it would also keep a private record of the post being tagged with #video. In your theme, you could then look for private tags conditionally and give them special formatting. "]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[2],0,"You can find documentation for theme development techniques like this and many more over on Ghost's extensive "],[0,[3],1,"theme documentation"],[0,[],1,"."]]],[1,"h1",[[0,[],0,"Dynamic Routing"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Dynamic routing gives you the ultimate freedom to build a custom publication to suit your needs. Routes are rules that map URL patterns to your content and templates. "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"For example, you may not want content tagged with "],[0,[1],1,"News"],[0,[],0," to exist on: "],[0,[1],1,"example.com/tag/news"],[0,[],0,". Instead, you want it to exist on "],[0,[1],1,"example.com/news"],[0,[],0," . "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In this case you can use dynamic routes to create customised collections of content on your site. It's also possible to use multiple templates in your theme to render each content type differently."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"There are lots of use cases for dynamic routing with Ghost, here are a few common examples: "]]],[3,"ul",[[[0,[],0,"Setting a custom home page with its own template"]],[[0,[],0,"Having separate content hubs for blog and podcast, that render differently, and have custom RSS feeds to support two types of content"]],[[0,[],0,"Creating a founders column as a unique view, by filtering content created by specific authors"]],[[0,[],0,"Including dates in permalinks for your posts"]],[[0,[],0,"Setting posts to have a URL relative to their primary tag like "],[0,[1],1,"example.com/europe/story-title/"],[1,[],0,0]]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[2],0,"Dynamic routing can be configured in Ghost using "],[0,[4],1,"YAML"],[0,[],0," files. Read our dynamic routing "],[0,[5],1,"documentation"],[0,[],1," for further details."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"You can further customise your site using "],[0,[6],1,"Apps & Integrations"],[0,[],0,"."]]]]}
entries.custom_excerpt: Ghost has a flexible organisational taxonomy called tags which can be used to configure your site structure using dynamic routing.

entries.title: Managing admin settings
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}],["soft-return","",{}]],"cards":[["image",{"src":"https://static.ghost.org/v1.0.0/images/private.png"}],["hr",{}]],"markups":[["a",["href","/ghost/settings/general/"]],["em"],["strong"],["a",["href","https://ghost.org/pricing/"]],["a",["href","/organising-content/"]]],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"There are a couple of things to do next while you're getting set up:"]]],[1,"h1",[[0,[],0,"Make your site private"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"If you've got a publication that you don't want the world to see yet because it's not ready to launch, you can hide your Ghost site behind a basic shared pass-phrase."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"You can toggle this preference on at the bottom of Ghost's "],[0,[0],1,"General Settings"],[0,[],0,":"]]],[10,0],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ghost will give you a short, randomly generated pass-phrase which you can share with anyone who needs access to the site while you're working on it. While this setting is enabled, all search engine optimisation features will be switched off to help keep your site under the radar."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Do remember though, this is "],[0,[1],1,"not"],[0,[],0," secure authentication. You shouldn't rely on this feature for protecting important private data. It's just a simple, shared pass-phrase for some very basic privacy."]]],[10,1],[1,"h1",[[0,[],0,"Invite your team "]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ghost has a number of different user roles for your team:"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[2],1,"Contributors"],[1,[],0,0],[0,[],0,"This is the base user level in Ghost. Contributors can create and edit their own draft posts, but they are unable to edit drafts of others or publish posts. Contributors are "],[0,[2],1,"untrusted"],[0,[],0," users with the most basic access to your publication."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[2],1,"Authors"],[1,[],0,1],[0,[],0,"Authors are the 2nd user level in Ghost. Authors can write, edit  and publish their own posts. Authors are "],[0,[2],1,"trusted"],[0,[],0," users. If you don't trust users to be allowed to publish their own posts, they should be set as Contributors."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[2],1,"Editors"],[1,[],0,2],[0,[],0,"Editors are the 3rd user level in Ghost. Editors can do everything that an Author can do, but they can also edit and publish the posts of others - as well as their own. Editors can also invite new Contributors+Authors to the site."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[2],1,"Administrators"],[1,[],0,3],[0,[],0,"The top user level in Ghost is Administrator. Again, administrators can do everything that Authors and Editors can do, but they can also edit all site settings and data, not just content. Additionally, administrators have full access to invite, manage or remove any other user of the site."],[1,[],0,4],[1,[],0,5],[0,[2],1,"The Owner"],[1,[],0,6],[0,[],0,"There is only ever one owner of a Ghost site. The owner is a special user which has all the same permissions as an Administrator, but with two exceptions: The Owner can never be deleted. And in some circumstances the owner will have access to additional special settings if applicable. For example: billing details, if using "],[0,[3,2],2,"Ghost(Pro)"],[0,[],0,"."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[1],1,"It's a good idea to ask all of your users to fill out their user profiles, including bio and social links. These will populate rich structured data for posts and generally create more opportunities for themes to fully populate their design."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Next up: "],[0,[4],1,"Organising your content"],[0,[],0," "]]]]}
entries.custom_excerpt: There are a couple of things to do next while you're getting set up: making your site private and inviting your team.

entries.title: Publishing options
entries.custom_excerpt: The Ghost editor has everything you need to fully optimise your content. This is where you can add tags and authors, feature a post, or turn a post into a page.

entries.title: Writing posts with Ghost
entries.custom_excerpt: Getting started with the editor is simple, with familiar formatting options in a functional toolbar and the ability to add dynamic content seamlessly.

entries.title: Welcome to Ghost
entries.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[["strong"],["a",["href","https://ghost.org/downloads/"]],["a",["href","https://ghost.org/pricing"]],["a",["href","https://github.com/TryGhost"]],["a",["href","/the-editor/"]],["em"]],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0," Welcome, it's great to have you here."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"We know that first impressions are important, so we've populated your new site with some initial "],[0,[0],1,"getting started"],[0,[],0," posts that will help you get familiar with everything in no time. This is the first one!"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[0],1,"A few things you should know upfront"],[0,[],0,":"]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[],0,"Ghost is designed for ambitious, professional publishers who want to actively build a business around their content. That's who it works best for. "]],[[0,[],0,"The entire platform can be modified and customised to suit your needs. It's very powerful, but does require some knowledge of code. Ghost is not necessarily a good platform for beginners or people who just want a simple personal blog. "]],[[0,[],0,"For the best experience we recommend downloading the "],[0,[1],1,"Ghost Desktop App"],[0,[],0," for your computer, which is the best way to access your Ghost site on a desktop device. "]]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Ghost is made by an independent non-profit organisation called the Ghost Foundation. We are 100% self funded by revenue from our "],[0,[2],1,"Ghost(Pro)"],[0,[],0," service, and every penny we make is re-invested into funding further development of free, open source technology for modern publishing."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The version of Ghost you are looking at right now would not have been made possible without generous contributions from the open source "],[0,[3],1,"community"],[0,[],0,"."]]],[1,"h2",[[0,[],0,"Next up, the editor"]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The main thing you'll want to read about next is probably: "],[0,[4],1,"the Ghost editor"],[0,[],0,". This is where the good stuff happens."]]],[1,"blockquote",[[0,[5],0,"By the way, once you're done reading, you can simply delete the default "],[0,[0],1,"Ghost"],[0,[],1," user from your team to remove all of these introductory posts! "]]]]}
entries.custom_excerpt:
Welcome, it's great to have you here.
We know that first impressions are important, so we've populated your new site with some initial getting started posts that will help you get familiar with everything in no time.
